title: Yasuo's E Rework idea
body:
So, most players already know about {{champion:157}} Yasuo's strengths and weaknesses. He has excellent harassment abilities at early game, he's also very versatile and can be played in any lane(or maybe the jungle; tell me if it works!), and his early-to-mid power spikes are enormous partly thanks to his innate double critical-chance. 

However Yasuo has his fair share of weaknesses; he is relatively squishy and is therefore at a slight disadvantage in the Season Five Bruiser Meta, and early crowd control will destroy him, but that's not what I want to discuss. 

Ok, straight to the point. I will show you a reworked version of Yasuo's Sweeping Blade which highlights what I am talking about.

(Listing modified factors only; stats are the same)

* Using Sweeping Blade on an allied unit will dissipate Yasuo's flow shield giving the target the shield for one second.
* Doing this will disable Sweeping blade for a longer cooldown and will cancel Yasuo's Rising Storm stacks.

Riot was emphasising "Strategic diversity" in late Season Four, and I think this rework fits the deal. 

This new version of Sweeping Blade means that while Yasuo can get away from a desperate problem such as a gank or a chaser by dashing through a trusty minion or support, he is vulnerable to further threats as his E is on cooldown longer and rids Yasuo of his essential dash skill. It can also encourage Yasuo players to play supportively also at a risk of losing fight potential.

Please, give me some feedback and share some ideas. If Riot uses this? Hooray, my dream comes true.

{{item:3074}} for life!

replies.body:
Maybe there should be a disable that affects Yasuo in a more significant way. Maybe all his skills have five seconds added to their cooldown? I really want to emphasise the fact that an allied dash should be an absolute last resort. I don't know, better ideas anyone? Maybe I'm just making him too difficult to play, which I'm fine with because I am fine with Azir and I also main Meepo from DOTA 2. 

{{item:3074}} for life. Best item ever.
But that's literally a straight up buff

"yas has defined strengths and weaknesses....lets just remove his biggest weakness"

yup, op is on some of the worst drugs ive ever seen....
And Yasuo doesn't need one of those. He's already OP as hell so just leave him as is.
